--0-1040518860-1076042486=:43047
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Malice heard her and rolled the heavy thing into the lab.  It was almost as tall as she was.
"One basalt sphere, ready for final manufacture, after I take a nap and have a meal of energon." 
He said the latter part sarcastically, for he was quite tired.  He was leaning against his handwork, trying to keep his optics open and his knees unlocked.

shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@...> wrote:
Wolfblade::

She had gone to the lab and worked on the magnet as soon as Malice 
had left the base. She was putting the finishing touches on it as she 
heard her name being called out. "I'm here in Lab number 5."


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice nodded and transformed into his beast mode.  He wanders 
outside of the base, searching for lava tubes or something.  After 
about a megacycle of wandering and searching, he finally found a 
basalt based lava flow and transformed.  He wadded about knee deep 
and absorbed the heat so he would not melt or warp his legs.  He got 
a hand full of the heavy thick stuff, and drew the heat out, leaving 
a solid mass.  He then dipped it into the lava, pulled it out, and 
repeated the process until it was halfway up his chest after several 
megacycles.  He rolled it out of the lava stream and began to roll it 
back to the base.
>  
>  
> Two megacycles later, Malice finally rolled the crude sphere like 
ball into the base.  He rolled it into the cargo bay, and went to 
find Wolfblade.
> "Hey Wolfblade, I finished the sphere!  Where are you?"  
>
